intro: Omphalea papuana, commonly known as the Papuan crown-bean, is a species of flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Omphalea papuana typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in sandy or loamy soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecological systems in its native habitat.
